newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: CRICKET-NEW SOUTH WALES WIN DESPITE RECORD PARTNERSHIP.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-NEW SOUTH WALES WIN DESPITE RECORD PARTNERSHIP.

text.p: A record breaking sixth wicket partnership of 290 between Matthew Elliott and Darren Berry was not enough to save Victoria from a 58-run defeat to New South Wales in their Sheffield Shield match on Monday.
Opener Elliott and wicketkeeper Berry took Victoria within sight of an improbable victory only to see the last five wickets fall for 19 runs in the final session of play.
Victoria had been set a winning target of 457 and collapsed badly on Sunday to be 89 for five when Berry joined Elliott atthe crease.
Elliott played an imperious innings, reaching 187 before the tall left-hander was bowled by leg-spinner Stuart MacGill, who took three second innings wickets in his first match for New South Wales.
Berry made 148, his highest score for Victoria, before falling in the next over to wrist-spinner David Freedman. Freedman cleaned up the Victorian tail to finish with four for 92 from 27 overs.

Elliott and Berry had taken Victoria to 349 for five at tea,raising hopes of a first win for new captain Shane Warne. Their partnership was a record for the sixth wicket in first-class matches between the two states.
Elliott led the Australian domestic averages last season with 1,233 runs at an average of 63.50, including five centuries from 11 first-class matches.
